newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BLACKBURN EXPRESS INTEREST IN BEBETO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BLACKBURN EXPRESS INTEREST IN BEBETO.

text.p: Blackburn Rovers, currently lying bottom of the English premier league and without a win this season, have expressed an interest in buying Brazilian striker Bebeto.

Blackburn, looking for a replacement for England striker Alan Shearer who was sold to Newcastle United for a world record 15 million sterling ($24 million), said the 32-year-old South American wanted to move to England from Brazilian club Flamengo.
British newspapers on Tuesday quoted Blackburn manager Ray Harford as saying: "There is no questioning the fact that he is a sensational player, one of the best players in the world.
"It seems he is very keen to come to England. He has seen the likes of Juninho do well over here and believes it offers a new challenge."

Newspaper reports said Harford had been contacted by Bebeto's agent and that the player was expected to cost around five million sterling ($8 million) in fees and wages. He moved to Flamengo from Spanish side Deportivo Coruna at the end of last season.
